# The `CFGuard.cpp` File Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This file contains the IR transform to add Microsoft&#39;s Control Flow Guard checks on Windows targets. <a href="#details">More...</a>

<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Adds Control Flow Guard (CFG) checks on indirect function calls/invokes.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="comment">/// These checks ensure that the target address corresponds to the start of an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="comment">/// address-taken function. X86&#95;64 targets use the Mechanism::Dispatch</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="comment">/// mechanism. X86, ARM, and AArch64 targets use the Mechanism::Check machanism.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-cfguard-cpp-/cfguardimpl"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-cfguard-cpp-/cfguardimpl/#a189c4eff521b392f0c9b9887491482e7">CFGuardImpl</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-cfguard-cpp-/cfguardimpl/#a0a73b0baf8c99b22b38b1c2898be8e69"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-cfguard-cpp-/cfguardimpl/#a0a73b0baf8c99b22b38b1c2898be8e69">Mechanism</a> = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cfguardpass/#ab92e96e8e3579c5aac36c65c19bcc128">CFGuardPass::Mechanism</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-cfguard-cpp-/cfguardimpl/#a189c4eff521b392f0c9b9887491482e7"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-cfguard-cpp-/cfguardimpl/#a189c4eff521b392f0c9b9887491482e7">CFGuardImpl</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-cfguard-cpp-/cfguardimpl/#a0a73b0baf8c99b22b38b1c2898be8e69">Mechanism</a> M) : GuardMechanism(M) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Get or insert the guard check or dispatch global symbols.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">switch</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (GuardMechanism) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">case</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Mechanism::Check:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="normal">      GuardFnName = </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;&#95;&#95;guard&#95;check&#95;icall&#95;fptr&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">break</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">case</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Mechanism::Dispatch:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><Highlight kind="normal">      GuardFnName = </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;&#95;&#95;guard&#95;dispatch&#95;icall&#95;fptr&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">break</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Inserts a Control Flow Guard (CFG) check on an indirect call using the CFG</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// check mechanism. When the image is loaded, the loader puts the appropriate</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// guard check function pointer in the &#95;&#95;guard&#95;check&#95;icall&#95;fptr global</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// symbol. This checks that the target address is a valid address-taken</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// function. The address of the target function is passed to the guard check</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// function in an architecture-specific register (e.g. ECX on 32-bit X86,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// X15 on Aarch64, and R0 on ARM). The guard check function has no return</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// value (if the target is invalid, the guard check funtion will raise an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// error).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// For example, the following LLVM IR:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   %func&#95;ptr = alloca i32 ()&#42;, align 8</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   store i32 ()&#42; @target&#95;func, i32 ()&#42;&#42; %func&#95;ptr, align 8</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   %0 = load i32 ()&#42;, i32 ()&#42;&#42; %func&#95;ptr, align 8</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   %1 = call i32 %0()</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\endcode</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// is transformed to:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   %func&#95;ptr = alloca i32 ()&#42;, align 8</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   store i32 ()&#42; @target&#95;func, i32 ()&#42;&#42; %func&#95;ptr, align 8</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   %0 = load i32 ()&#42;, i32 ()&#42;&#42; %func&#95;ptr, align 8</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   %1 = load void (i8&#42;)&#42;, void (i8&#42;)&#42;&#42; @&#95;&#95;guard&#95;check&#95;icall&#95;fptr</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   %2 = bitcast i32 ()&#42; %0 to i8&#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   call cfguard&#95;checkcc void %1(i8&#42; %2)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   %3 = call i32 %0()</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\endcode</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// For example, the following X86 assembly code:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   movl  $&#95;target&#95;func, %eax</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   calll &#42;%eax</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\endcode</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// is transformed to:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   movl  $&#95;target&#95;func, %ecx</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   calll &#42;&#95;&#95;&#95;guard&#95;check&#95;icall&#95;fptr</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   calll &#42;%ecx</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\endcode</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param CB indirect call to instrument.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> insertCFGuardCheck(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase">CallBase</a> &#42;CB);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Inserts a Control Flow Guard (CFG) check on an indirect call using the CFG</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// dispatch mechanism. When the image is loaded, the loader puts the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// appropriate guard check function pointer in the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#95;&#95;guard&#95;dispatch&#95;icall&#95;fptr global symbol. This checks that the target</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// address is a valid address-taken function and, if so, tail calls the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// target. The target address is passed in an architecture-specific register</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// (e.g. RAX on X86&#95;64), with all other arguments for the target function</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// passed as usual.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// For example, the following LLVM IR:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   %func&#95;ptr = alloca i32 ()&#42;, align 8</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   store i32 ()&#42; @target&#95;func, i32 ()&#42;&#42; %func&#95;ptr, align 8</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   %0 = load i32 ()&#42;, i32 ()&#42;&#42; %func&#95;ptr, align 8</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   %1 = call i32 %0()</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\endcode</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// is transformed to:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   %func&#95;ptr = alloca i32 ()&#42;, align 8</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   store i32 ()&#42; @target&#95;func, i32 ()&#42;&#42; %func&#95;ptr, align 8</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   %0 = load i32 ()&#42;, i32 ()&#42;&#42; %func&#95;ptr, align 8</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   %1 = load i32 ()&#42;, i32 ()&#42;&#42; @&#95;&#95;guard&#95;dispatch&#95;icall&#95;fptr</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   %2 = call i32 %1() &#91; &quot;cfguardtarget&quot;(i32 ()&#42; %0) &#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\endcode</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// For example, the following X86&#95;64 assembly code:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   leaq   target&#95;func(%rip), %rax</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   callq  &#42;%rax</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\endcode</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// is transformed to:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   leaq   target&#95;func(%rip), %rax</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   callq  &#42;&#95;&#95;guard&#95;dispatch&#95;icall&#95;fptr(%rip)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\endcode</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param CB indirect call to instrument.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> insertCFGuardDispatch(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase">CallBase</a> &#42;CB);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> doInitialization(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/module">Module</a> &amp;M);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/entryexitinstrumenter-cpp/#a3985f1f39349428d17f0d2b81ebc6349">runOnFunction</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
